sentences.en: He could hear that her breathing was uneven.
sentences.cn: 他能听到她的呼吸不均匀。

sentences.en: He staggered on the uneven surface of the car park.
sentences.cn: 他摇摇晃晃地行走在停车场凹凸不平的地面上。

sentences.en: He stumbled on the uneven ground and fell flat on his face.
sentences.cn: 他在不平的地上绊了一跤,摔了个嘴啃地.

sentences.en: Her works have been rather uneven this year.
sentences.cn: 她今年的作品相当参差不齐.
这是一场不公平的竞赛。

sentences.en: She gazed round the church at the grey uneven walls and the vivid stained glass windows.
sentences.cn: 她四下打量了一番教堂凹凸不平的灰色墙壁和色彩鲜艳的彩色玻璃窗。

sentences.en: She walked back carefully over the uneven ground.
sentences.cn: 她小心翼翼地从凹凸不平的地面上走回来。

sentences.en: The floor felt uneven under his feet.
sentences.cn: 他觉得脚下的地板高低不平。

sentences.en: The heterogeneity and uneven development of China's economy are rather advantageous in the war of resistance.
sentences.cn: 中国经济的不统一、不平衡,对于抗日战争反为有利.

sentences.en: The pieces of wood are uneven in length and can't be used.
sentences.cn: 这些木条长短不齐,没法用.

sentences.en: The side tracks off the tarred road were rutted and uneven.
sentences.cn: 柏油路面两边的辅道上布满车辙，凹凸不平。

sentences.en: The table wobbled on its uneven legs.
This was, for him, an oddly uneven performance.
sentences.cn: 对他而言，这场演出时好时坏，很是奇怪。

sentences.en: What kids experience now is an uneven rate of development. They are forced to be older than their years.
sentences.cn: 小孩子现在的问题是成长速度不均衡。他们被迫变得比自己的实际年龄老成。

words.tran_cn: 不均衡地；不平坦地；不平行地

trans.tran_cn: 不平坦的，凹凸不平的，不一律的，参差不齐的，不势均力敌的，[数]奇数的
